            Bio
            Ankit Kumar is a Masters student in Data Analytics and Computational Social Science at University of Massachusetts Amherst. He is interested in sports analytics, social network analysis, legal analytics, health, marketing analytics and risk management.
            
            
            Education
            Delhi School of Economics | Delhi, India
            M.A. in Economics | 2016
            University of Delhi | Delhi, India
            B.A.(Hons.) in Economics | 2013
            
            
            Experience
            Institute of Economics Growth | Research Assistant | February 2019 - November 2019
            Institute of Economics Growth | Research Analyst | October 2018 - January 2019
            Chief Minister’s Good Governance Associates, Haryana, India | Research Analyst | October 2017 - August 2018
            Ashoka University | Teaching Assistant | August 2016 - December 2017

          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
          
            Abhinav Kumar
          
          
            
          
          
            György Herzl is a filmmaker and computational storyteller based in Leipzig, Germany. Their work has been featured at the Festival do Rio, Internationale Filmfestspiele Berlin, Kunsthalle Basel, and the New Museum of Contemporary Art in New York City. “ГУМ” is their latest project which examines the rise of consumerism in post-Soviet republics.

articles.title: Erin Tracy
articles.contents:
DACSS 601 August 2021
          
          
          About
          Syllabus
          Students
          Example Data
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
          
            Erin Tracy
          
          
            
          
          
            Hi, I’m Erin! I am an incoming DACSS UWW student with my B.S. in Interdisciplinary Social Sciences and Early Childhood Education from James Madison University. I work for the Massachusetts Teachers Association. My research interest is primarily in comparing teacher salaries/benefits across comparative districts, and other research related to union negotiations. I am from Warner NH, but now live in Wakefield, MA with my husband and 4 year old son, Mitchell.

articles.title: Meredith Rolfe
articles.contents:
DACSS 601 August 2021
          
          
          About
          Syllabus
          Students
          Example Data
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Meredith Rolfe
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        DACSS
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            Meredith holds a BA Comparative Area Studies from Duke University, and an MA and PhD in Political Science from the University of Chicago. She is currently an Associate Professor of Political Science at University of Massachusetts Amherst and the Program Director of the Data Analytics and Computational Social Science (DACSS). She was previously hold positions as a Postdoctoral Prize Fellow in Sociology at Oxford University and Lecturer in Public Management at the London School of Economics.
            Meredith was using R before it was cool (and when it was still called S). Her research interests include all things related to the cognitive microfoundations and structure of social interaction, with methodological interests including networks, text, simulations, experiments, and surveys.
            Hometown: Charlotte, NC
            Hobbies: um, DACSS???
            Fun fact: Coffee is my favorite food
            
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Meredith Rolfe
            
            
              
                
                                    
                    
                      GitHub
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      DACSS
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      Email

She was previously hold positions as a Postdoctoral Prize Fellow in Sociology at Oxford University and Lecturer in Public Management at the London School of Economics.
              Meredith was using R before it was cool (and when it was still called S). Her research interests include all things related to the cognitive microfoundations and structure of social interaction, with methodological interests including networks, text, simulations, experiments, and surveys.

            Bio
            Joey Wolpert is originally from Framingham, MA. He recently graduated from UMass Amherst undergrad and is an incoming DACSS masters student this semester.
            His research interests include public opinion, surverying, and economic forecasting. He is excited to join the cohort in Amherst this fall and get to know everybody during the year!
            
            
            Education
            University of Massachusetts Amherst | Amherst, MA
            M.S. in Data Analytics and Computational Social Science | Summer 2021 - Present
            University of Massachusetts Amherst | Amherst, MA
            B.S. in Computer Science; B.S. in Mathematics | September 2018 - May 2021
            
            
            Experience
            DraftKings | Data Analyst Intern | Summer 2021
            Netflix | Software Engineer Intern | Summer 2020
            
            
            R Code
            Here’s some R code that makes a graph!
            ## [1] "This is the mean of the y values: "
            ## [1] "0.01827012"
            ## [1] "This is the standard deviation of the y values: "
            ## [1] "1.01847544004595"

          Bio

I am from Ipswich, Massachusetts, and have lived in Boston MA, Western MA, Brooklyn NY, Northern Virginia, and Santa Fe, NM.

articles.contents:
DACSS 601 August 2021
          
          
          About
          Syllabus
          Students
          Example Data
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Larri Miller
          
          
            
              Hi, I’m Larri! I am an incoming Communication PhD student with my M.S. in DACSS and a B.A. in Cognitive Science and Psychology. My research interest is primarily in disinformation flow via social media; more generally, I am interested in the intersection of media, technology, and society. I am from DuBois, Pennsylvania, and I currently live in Amherst, MA with my bunny Cleo!
            
            
              Hi, I’m Larri! I am an incoming Communication PhD student with my M.S. in DACSS and a B.A. in Cognitive Science and Psychology.             Saulo DePaula
          
          
            
          
          
            Hello, my name is Saulo. Learning a lot with R already!
            
            Education/Work Background
            BA in Sociology (2015) and MEd in Higher Education (2017), both from UMass Amherst. Director of Analytics and Operations for the College of Social and Behavioral Sciences.
            
            
            Program
            PhD in Higher Education (expected 2023) at UMass Amherst.
            
            
            R experience
            Minimal.
            
            
            Research Interests
            Remote Work, Organizations, Leadership Development, Conflict Management, Productivity, Efficiency, Bureaucracy.
            
            
            Hometown
            Marlborough, MA
            
            
            Hobbies
            Cycling, home improvement projects, Excel (it can be a hobby…).
            
            
            Fun Fact
            I lived in Brazil for five years.
